title: Cuyen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Pegos Claros Rosé (Palmela)
description: For some reason, this wine has had partial fermentation in wood. It does little for the fruit, giving the wine a bitter edge—an unusual experiment that doesn't come off.

title: Santa Alicia 2016 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)
description: Thunderous oak-related aromas are so strong and dominant they might make you wince. This is all pulp and resin on the palate, while flavors of clove and wood spice don't allow for any fruit flavors to step up. This is one of the most singularly oaky Chardonnays you'll find.
designation: Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled

title: Santos & Santos 2015 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte White (Alentejano)
description: The wine is ripe, soft and fat. It has some attractive apple flavors although not enough to balance the neutral texture and acidity. Drink now.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Chalky dust gives this wine a harsh texture, around which hang green, herbal suggestions of cedar and sage.

title: Catman 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a generic red, with no varietal particularity. Slightly sweaty and drying out, it's simple and short with a quick tart finish.

title: Château Côte Montpezat 2016 Le Canon Côte Montpezat Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: A light-colored rosé, this is too pale for its own tastiness. There is acidity, but not much else.

title: Médeville Collection 2016 8 Generation Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is bland, with a soft texture and little fruit. A kick of pepper shows at the end.

title: Dourthe 2016 La Grande Cuvée Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a bright wine, packed with acidity as much as fruit. Tangy and juicy, it finishes with spice. Drink wine now.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Pansa Rosada Rosé (Alella)
description: An orange peel note infiltrates this fading rosé's squash and pumpkin aromas, feeling at once shrill and oxidized. Aside from mushroom and clam shell flavors, it offers little on the finish.

title: Hello World 2015 Petit Verdot (Tierra de Castilla)
description: Reduced prune and green herb aromas tell you all you need to know about this jammy, overextracted Petit Verdot. Its roasted black fruit flavors come with hints of spice and chocolate, but drilling tannins and overbearing weight hinder the finish.

title: Santa Maria La Palma 2016 Aragosta Rosato (Alghero)
description: This informal rosato has shy aromas of red berry and citrus blossom while the light-bodied, rather diluted, palate offers suggestions of red cherry and strawberry. It's fresh but extremely simple.

title: Château Lescalle 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Very pale, almost white in color, this wine is flat and lacks fruit. A touch of spice helps. Drink now.

title: Cuyen 2016 Chardonnay (Central Valley)
description: Simple orange and pineapple aromas are reasonably clean but bland. This is plump on the finish, without much structure or spine. Yeasty white-fruit flavors lack pop, while this tastes bready on the finish.

title: Gran Verano 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Melony aromas are soft and candied. On the palate, this is watery and doesn't offer much sizzle. Pithy citrus flavors are typical of Chilean SB, however this is flat on the finish.

title: Espiritu de Chile 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)
description: A light rusty color and aromas of dried leaves and asphalt are not substantial or fruity. This feels raw, while lightly oxidized yeasty flavors taste like dried berry fruits and little more. A bland finish is not surprising.

title: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Earthy oaky horsey aromas lack charm and seem clipped. This Carmenère is hard-edged and scratchy in feel, with lightly green berry flavors. A full but choppy finish creates a rough conclusion.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2016 Rosado (Cigales)
description: This blend of Tempranillo and Verdejo feels chunky. It shows jumbled vinegar and rubber aromas and briny citrus flavors that add a bit of character to the finish.

title: Santa Ema 2015 Reserva Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Herbal foxy red-berry and wayward oak aromas are fierce. A narrow linear palate is choppy, while stripped-back red plum and currant flavors are not helped by buttery oak. An herbal tasting finish is sharp in feel.

title: Château de la Rivière 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Almost white in color, this wine has just a touch of red fruit and acidity. In making it so light in color, the producer seems to have removed the flavor as well.

title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Carmenère (Apalta)
description: Flat earthy baked aromas of prune and raisin include a hint of vanilla. Frankly, this lacks balance and feels both heavy and high in tartaric acidity. Meaty salty savory red-fruit flavors are herbal on a raw chunky finish.

title: Finca Enguera 2015 Verdil (Valencia)
description: This is Verdil from Valencia, and it amounts to funk in a glass. Its yellow color and lightly oxidized apple and haystack aromas set the stage for a flat palate that lacks structure and acidity. Its apple and peach flavors finish honeyed. Drink now.

title: Protos 2016 P Rosé (Ribera del Duero)
description: A Day-Glo pink color and presentable but dull red fruit aromas lead into a rubbery palate. Briny, sour pickled citrus flavors finish with no charm.

title: Hello World 2015 Cabernet Franc (Tierra de Castilla)
description: Green, minty aromas dominate this Cabernet Franc. It's grippy and tannic on the palate, its herbal, weedy black fruit flavors leading to a sweet note of blueberry. Green accents mark the chewy, thick finish.

title: Chilcas 2014 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Leafy earthy berry aromas are mild at best. This feels flat despite a shock of red-berry acidity that doesn't sit right. Plastic and jammy raspberry flavors show some oak that fails to integrate itself on the finish.

title: Cantina di Ruvo 2016 Grifo Rosato (Castel del Monte)
description: Made with Bombino Nero grapes, this casual rosato has subdued aromas of red berry and spring flower. It's extremely simple and light-bodied, offering a suggestion of raspberry and citrus alongside zesty acidity.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Parvus Rosé (Alella)
description: This wine's aromas recall yeast, sea shells and crab meat more than fruit. On the palate, it's oily and thick, with bready stone fruit flavors that lack freshness and finish bitter.

title: Barrel Road 2015 Red (California)
description: Smoky aromas and strong chocolate and cappucino flavors make this a very unusual beverage—tasty in its way but problematic for those who like traditional dry wine. It's semisweet and feels rich on the palate.

title: Le Battistelle 2014 Roccolo del Durlo  (Soave Classico)
description: Aromas evoking adhesive bandage and burned plastic carry over to the lean brisk palate.

title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This soft, bland wine misses out on flavor, although it is clean. Drink now.
